events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of May 1st involving a collision at a traffic light.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident as the report clearly mentions vehicle collision and damages.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the vehicle accident claim and begin client communication.
The customer was promptly contacted and acknowledged that their claim has been received and is being processed.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report to assist the investigation of the accident.
The customer uploaded all required documents including damage images and the official police accident report.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence and contacting witnesses to validate the accident details.
The investigation confirmed the accident facts and liability, allowing the claim to move to the settlement phase.
An initial settlement amount was proposed to cover the repair costs and any medical expenses resulting from the accident.
The customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and requested the next steps to finalize the claim.
After validating all details, the claim was formally approved for payment according to the proposed settlement.
The settlement payment was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s account for repairs and associated expenses.
The claim has been formally closed after successful payment, with no outstanding issues reported by the customer.
All claim documents and communication were archived for record-keeping and future reference if needed.
